ezRNAseq
  • Reference

RNAseq Workflow

RNAseq Workflow. Alignment with STAR and read counting with R/Bioconductor.

rnaseq_workflow(data_dir = getwd(), samples.annotation = "samples.txt",
  pairedEnd = TRUE, fastq.gz = TRUE,
  star.index = "/eqmoreaux/genomes/Homo_sapiens/Ensembl/GRCh37/Sequence/StarIndex/",
  gtf = "/eqmoreaux/genomes/Homo_sapiens/Ensembl/GRCh37/Annotation/Genes/genes.gtf",
  result.dir = getwd(), keep = c("name_sorted_bam"),
  ignore.strand = FALSE, count.mode = "Union", thread = 10,
  data.analyst = list(name = "", email = ""), data.author = list(name = "",
  email = ""))

Arguments

data_dir
the directory containing the data. It should contains a subdirectory called "FASTQ" which contains fastq files. Default value is the working directory
samples.annotation
the path to "samples.txt" tabulation file containing sample annotations. This file should contain at least 3 columns:
  • name: corresponding to sample name. It will be used to report the result
  • fastq1: the first fastq file name for paired-end sequencing
  • fastq2: the second fastq file name for paired-end sequencing. This is optional if single-end sequencing is used
pairedEnd
specify if the data are paired-end sequencing data. Default is TRUE.
fastq.gz
specify if the FASTQ files are compressed. Default is TRUE.
star.index
reference genome for STAR.
gtf
gene annotation file.
result.dir
The absolute path of result directory.
keep
a character vector specifying the file to be kept. Allowed values include c("name_sorted_bam", "chr_sorted_bam", "sam" ).
ignore.strand
A logical indicating if strand should be considered when matching. if TRUE, allows minus strand reads to count in plus strand genes, and vice versa. Should be FALSE for stranded RNAsequencing.
count.mode
counting mode. Read ?GenomicAlignments::summarizeOverlaps. Default value is "Union". Reads that overlap any portion of exactly one feature are counted. Reads that overlap multiple features are discarded.
thread
Number of threads to be used. This depends to the available computer ressources.
data.analyst
a list containing the name and the email of the data analyst.
data.author
a list containing the name and the email of the data author.

Value

Can create three subdirectories:

  • SAM: containing the output of STAR alignment program
  • BAM: containing unsorted and sorted BAM files, and BAM index file. BAM comtent is sorted by read names (*_name_sorted.bam) or by chromosome (*_sorted.bam). The index files are of form *_sorted.bam.bai. *_name_sorted.bam files are used for read counting using hseq-count or R. *_sorted.bam and *_sorted.bam.bai files can be used for IGV visualization.
  • COUNT: containing read counting results. It contains the following files: 1. se.RDATA: containing an object "se" which is an object of class SummarizedExperiment

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
